image.altText: A composite black and white image depicting baby Kobi Shepherdson and glasses-wearing Henry Shepherdson

props.synopsis:
Henry Shepherdson inflicted months of coercive control on the mother of Kobi Shepherdson before killing the nine-month-old in a murder-suicide that shocked Australia. The harrowing police statements of Kobi's mother reveal the extent of his manipulation.

Â

title.children: 'Please don't do this': Mother's plea before baby killed in murder-suicide

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: Two SA Police employees have been reported for unrelated corruption offences in just two days.

title.children: Two SAPOL employees facing unrelated corruption charges

image.altText: Egg shelves 1 (1)

props.synopsis: Eggs are in short supply on some major supermarket shelves months after the avian influenza outbreak, and farmers say it could be some time before supply is back to normal.

title.children: No quick fix for egg producers struggling to fill shortage

image.altText: Zoe in her yellow Wiggle uniform (yellow skivy, a black skirt and tights) stands on an empty stage

props.synopsis: Like so many Australian children, Zoe Karatzovalis grew up watching The Wiggles. Now, she's gone from auditioning for The Wiggles with 160 other people to being introduced on stage by Anthony Field, the original Blue Wiggle, as Zoe Wiggle.

title.children: 'Surreal' moment for one of The Wiggles' newest recruits

image.altText: Researchers in protective suits conduct meth testing.

props.synopsis: Second-hand car buyers could potentially be at risk of third-hand exposure to methamphetamine, with new research examining the extent to which the drug spreads to surfaces such as dashboards in contaminated cars.

title.children: Meth research triggers warning to prospective second-hand car buyers

image.altText: Emmett Prime sings into a microphone  while holding a guitar and surrounded by lights

props.synopsis: Social media has been a "beautiful tool" to connect psychedelic-rock group Maisie to its audience, but a desire from music organisations and record labels for large social media engagement is having an impact on some live music acts accessing funding and opportunities.

title.children: Has social media become more important in music than the art itself?

image.altText: Two people holding glasses stand either side of a barrel with a bottle of brandy on top of it.

props.synopsis: Grapes damaged by a devastating bushfire in the Adelaide Hills in late 2019 have been turned into brandy. The research, led by the University of Adelaide, is part of a wider project aiming to help producers navigate the setbacks of climate change.

title.children: Grapes tainted by smoke from bushfire transformed into brandy

image.altText: Several police cars parked on a curved street, with officers standing outside, and trees in the background.

props.synopsis: South Australia's police chief says he has seen bodycam footage of an incident in which officers fatally shot an armed man at a home in Adelaide's south, saying those at the scene appeared to have taken the "necessary" steps to act in self-defence.

title.children: Police who fatally shot armed man took 'necessary' steps, commissioner says

image.altText: An open fire hydrant stands amidst a damaged neighborhood severely impacted by wildfires

props.synopsis: As wildfires raged across Los Angeles, it took just days for another disaster to rear its head â the city seemed to be running out of water to fight them.

title.children: Fire hydrants are running dry in Los Angeles â but it's not exactly for lack of water

image.altText: A house on fire with the majority of it destroyed

props.synopsis: Fires burning in and around Los Angeles have claimed the homes of thousands of people, including numerous celebrities such as Anthony Hopkins and Tina Knowles.Â

title.children: Celebrity homes among more than 10,000 structures lost in LA fires

image.altText: David Bowman

props.synopsis: The flammable Tasmanian blue gum has caused friction among Californians in the past for its role in wildfires. Scientists say the fire-loving tree is one factor in a complex story of climate change.

title.children: Scientists say fire-loving Tasmanian blue gums not to blame for LA fires

image.altText: Police cars and officers speaking to people on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A man who had recently absconded from a Queensland hospital was shot twice in the stomach after lunging at police officers during an altercation.

title.children: Man escaped from hospital before police shooting in Brisbane

image.altText: Police tape blocks off a street with police officers standing nearby.

props.synopsis: A 52-year-old man who died earlier this week was allegedly kidnapped with two others in south-west Brisbane and subject to "extreme violence".

title.children: Queensland man subjected to hours of 'extreme violence' in alleged murder

image.altText: A woman in a pink top stands with a mustachioed man

props.synopsis: When Jimmy Carter's granddaughter fell in love with an Australian artist, the former president tracked down Stephen Reynolds' blog about travel escapades as a young single man. He wasn't impressed.Â

title.children: The Aussie 'playboy' who fell in love with an ex-US president's granddaughter

image.altText: AFP

props.synopsis: A UN committee finds Australia violated a human rights treaty by detaining a group of asylum seekers, including minors, on Nauru even after they were granted refugee status.

title.children: Australia violated human rights treaty with Nauru detainees, UN finds

image.altText: A group of men in a circle praying in a church.

props.synopsis: More than 150 people are on a waiting list for a residential drug and alcohol rehabilitation program in Kalgoorlie-Boulder after Shalom House closed its centre in Kalgoorlie-Boulder.

title.children: Controversial 'tough love' rehab facility to close Goldfields operations

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Hadi Nazari was reported missing in the Kosciuszko National Park on Boxing Day

props.synopsis: After receiving treatment for dehydration, Hadi Nazari has now been discharged from Cooma Hospital, NSW Health officials confirmed.

title.children: Hiker Hadi Nazari discharged from hospital

image.altText: A fuzzy photo of a white ute

props.synopsis: A four-year-old boy is in a critical condition after a vehicle hit him on a suburban road in Albury this morning. The driver fled the scene and a police investigation is underway.

title.children: Police hunt for driver who critically injured a child in NSW hit-and-run

image.altText: A man in suit waving South Korean national flag.

props.synopsis: South Koreans fearing the communist "wind from the north" back impeached president Yoon Suk Yeol, but he looks to shamans and mysticism to guide him into and through office.

title.children: The fortune teller who may be pulling the strings on Korea's wild political crisis

image.altText: a traffic controller on a worksite

props.synopsis: Politicians and news outlets claim Australian traffic controllers are earning $200,000 per year. The ABC has crunched the numbers to see how credible these claims are.

title.children: Are Australian traffic controllers really earning $200k per year?

image.altText: Children play near strong waves from the Pasig River amid Super Typhoon Man-yi in November 2024.

props.synopsis: Floods and devastating storms gave way to heatwaves in a year that broke all previous temperature records, according to international climate agency Copernicus.Â

title.children: Incredible flood pictures tell us the story of the new hottest year on record

image.altText: A phone in a green case with a white screen. It is showing the keypad needed to dial a number and zero bars of reception

props.synopsis: Firefighters battling blazes in Victoria's Grampians National Park say mobile phone reception was "nearly non-existent" and have called for better coverage on the fireground.

title.children: Firefighters plea for better phone coverage after Grampians reception issues

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti mentioning Hitler and showing a swastika along a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Police say the incident at the Allawah synagogue is believed to have happened in the early hours of Friday morning.

title.children: 'Enough is enough': Swastikas sprayed on walls of Sydney synagogue

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios, wearing a puffer jacket and green cap, listening to a question during a press conference

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios gives the strongest indication he will be fit to play in the Australian Open, declaring his abdominal injury "manageable" two days out from the first grand slam of the year.

title.children: Kyrgios steps up Australian Open preparation in a positive sign

image.altText: A man in a blue jumper speaks to an interviewer.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic says the food he received during his visa saga ahead of the 2022 Australian Open poisoned him.

title.children: Djokovic wants to 'focus on tennis' after COVID detention poisoning claim

image.altText: Two women under a cabana

props.synopsis: Tourism Australia's beach ambassador Brad Farmer believes the time has come for regulations amid a cabana takeover on Australian beaches.

title.children: Is it time to draw a line in the sand on beach cabanas?

image.altText: Virat Kohli with a worried expression

props.synopsis: Virat Kohli unsuccessfully did everything in his power to recapture his previous glory in the loss to Australia and it leaves him and India needing answers to some tough questions.

title.children: Sobering series loss leaves Kohli staring squarely at cricketing mortality

image.altText: 06_closer swir view of burning buildings_altadena california_08jan2025_wv3

props.synopsis: Multiple fires burning in Los Angeles, California, have razed neighbourhoods and decimated Hollywood landmarks in one of the country's worst-ever fire disasters.

title.children: Satellite images reveal devastating scale of LA fires

image.altText: Three female customers looking a book lined shelves.

props.synopsis: Australians' love of cheap books is driving independent bookstores and writers out of business. These prominent authors believe there is a simple solution.

title.children: Australians love cheap books. Here's why that's a problem

image.altText: horses snip

props.synopsis: Where do you place an animal with a mind of its own, equally terrified of the most destructive and devastating fire in Los Angeles history?Â

title.children: As LA struggles to save animals and pets, images of bravery and tragedy emerge

image.altText: A close-up of an umbrella being held by a person walking through the city, with rain droplets visible on the black material.

props.synopsis: Storms are expected to continue across parts of Queensland this weekend, while a heatwave in the state's north-west could deliver temperatures in the mid-to-high 40s.

title.children: Queensland homes lose power in storms as BOM predicts more wet weather

image.altText: Demi Moore smiling holding a Golden Globe.

props.synopsis: Righto then smarty pants, think you've been paying attention to the news this week? Test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Free food, Golden Globes and Meta's moderator problem
